p: The maximal growths (defined by means of H m parameter) were obtained in the cultures that were formulated with SBP (less in the case of SBP_Me). The values of H m in SBP_G and SBP_Bo were significantly greater than the rest of media. Nevertheless, the values of lag growth phases and maximum growth rates were similar in all media ( p > 0.05). The most efficient peptones in producing biomass in terms of the growth yields regarding nutrient uptakes ( Y X/RS and Y X/Pr ) were also SBP_G and SBP_Bo. These findings are in agreement with the results that were reported for the growth of lactic acid bacteria using nitrogen sources obtained from enzymatic and alkaline effluents that are generated in the isolation of chitin from squid pens [ 46].
